title: Layout of trait objects differs from rustc
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
extern "C" {
    fn printf(s: *const i8, ...);
}

struct Foo(i32);
trait Bar {
    fn baz(&self);
}

impl Bar for Foo {
    fn baz(&self) {
        unsafe {
            let a = "%i\n\0";
            let b = a as *const str;
            let c = b as *const i8;

            printf(c, self.0);
        }
    }
}

fn dynamic_dispatch(t: &dyn Bar) {
    t.baz();
}

fn main() {
    let a = &Foo(123);
    let b: &dyn Bar = a;
    dynamic_dispatch(b);
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 

```
Temporary breakpoint 1, test::main () at test.rs:27
27          let a = &Foo(123);
(gdb) n
28          let b: &dyn Bar = a;
(gdb) n
29          dynamic_dispatch(b);
(gdb) p b
$1 = test::&Bar {pointer: 0x555555588004 "{\000", vtable: 0x5555555948b8}
(gdb) p b.vtable
$2 = (*mut [usize; 3]) 0x5555555948b8
(gdb) p *b.vtable
$3 = [93824992252368, 4, 4]
```

Instead, this happened:

```
Temporary breakpoint 1, main () at test.rs:27
27          let a = &Foo(123);
(gdb) n
28          let b: &dyn Bar = a;
(gdb) n
29          dynamic_dispatch(b);
(gdb) p b
$1 = (const dyn [Bar] &) @0x7fffffffdc40: {__receiver_trait_obj_ptr: 0x7fffffffdc5c, __0: 0x401162 <TestCrate::Foo::baz>}
```

see: 

https://github.com/bminor/binutils-gdb/blob/79541a6d9220e800ebc5278594105982d6e1d80c/gdb/rust-lang.c#L231-L262



### Meta

- What version of Rust GCC were you using, git sha if possible. 69f6be3ee483c9895b4b5187a44b3e1c8be2ba63
